Functions of special effects of techs
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 3 Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Functions of special effects of techs
By Tigerbubble on Thursday, February 7, 2002 - 11:26 am:

Does anyone have a full understanding of what addled, stun, dizzy and the other special effects that some techs have, actually do?

On the side, what is a clay doll? apparently my dragon hates them, but i am not sure what it is.

By Kaiser on Thursday, February 7, 2002 - 05:47 pm:

As far as i've played the dizzy affect allows your monster to hit the opponet easier, as my dragon/brilla used his tail attack which dizzied him and allowed my bite to hit even though it missd many times before but maybe the percentage just kicked in!

By Eagle Fierce on Thursday, February 7, 2002 - 06:24 pm:

Here's my interpretation, based on visual battle experience:

Dizzy - Lowers percentage to take any action effectively (I.E. dodge, block, attack)

Stun - Makes the opponent unable to dodge the next attack effectively (though, they are capable of fighting and blocking plenty)

Shaken - Unsure, possibly the opposite of "Stun," making the monster unable to block effectively

Guard - Opponent is unable to make contact with their next attack, without use of special characteristics (I.E. "Sharp Eyes" & "Radar")

Addled - The monster is confused, and GUTS increases at a slower rate. Hit% plummets

Haven't the foggiest clue what a "Clay Doll" is. I thought it was an accessory or something.

By Nate Railsback on Friday, February 8, 2002 - 05:07 pm:

Shaken lowers your damage-dealing ability dramatically.

By Dragonmasterx50 on Tuesday, February 12, 2002 - 07:02 pm:

You forgot "Slow" Eagle Fierce. It has the same effect as "Dizzy", but I think guts go slower too. It would make sense because the effect's name is "Slow" heh heh.
